algorithm_technique: Greedy approach: check if target state (all 1s or all -1s) is reachable within k operations.
problem_summary_simple: Determine if an array of 1s and -1s can be made uniform using at most k operations.
problem_summary_technical: Checks if all elements can be made equal (1 or -1) by applying adjacent sign flips within k operations.
key_insights: The operation flips adjacent elements. This means the parity of the number of flips matters.
Consider the target state: all 1s or all -1s.
The greedy strategy involves minimizing the number of operations needed to reach a target state.
